fields.summary: create alarm from metrics landing page

comments.body: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1878

Hopefully, this is good to go. The visual stuff should be addressed in a common ticket, but functionality seems to be there.

Oh, one thing I may still need to resolve. If a graph has multiple lines, which should be used for create alarm when selected on graph action menu? (or all dims?) I currently just use 1st one which probably isn't correct.

[~dkavanagh], since the graph is the same metric but different dimensions, I thought the team had discussed that we could have the single alarm created for the multiple dimensions. hence the remove alarm from resource dialog instead of simply linking to delete alarm if you do that from the resource landing page, since the alarm could still be associated with other dimensions. Did I misunderstand where we ended up there? That is certainly possible, there was a lot happening at that point. LMK.
This will take a little more work. AFAIK, the create alarm dialog isn't geared towards multiple dimensions.

Hm, it should be. That was in the wireframe for the design, and I think some of the metrics require >1 dimension, like per lb per AZ?

[~ashamblin], got any insight here?

Looking at the create alarm code, it's really not geared towards multiple dimensions. I can make the changes to support that as I did for charting. Wondering if that should be done in this branch since it's needed here or as separate ticket?
Might as well do it here if you don't mind. I don't mind!
One linked bug blocks part of this, but the dialog now properly handles multiple dimensions.
I've addressed the dimensions issue discussed in GUI-2525 (linking to here). When you're done reviewing, feel free to merge and assign to Jenny for UX.
Reviewed, passed and merged.  Please UX revoew on master.

UX review from Master:

* resource name is not being included in name field
* If I open the create alarm dialog for a metric, close it and reopen it a second time, the name field is blank, there are no dimensions populated and the metric is not populated. Screenshot attached. 
Stopped UX review at that point since functionality seems fundamentally broken.

For resource name, what should we do when multiple names are provided? list them all, dash separated?

There is a fundamental problem in that some initialization is happening in a link function and that doesn't get invoked w/ subsequent calls for this dialog before a re-load. That's something I'll discuss w/ Adam.
Could do "multiple" for resource names, and be sure name conflict resolution still works (it should, just worth checking)

Copying styling issues noted by [~jloza] in GUI-2504 here, as they only seem to affect the create alarm dialog on the metrics landing page...

* labels remain indented much, much too far
* cancel link in actions section should be gray (green on hover no underline please), and needs more spacing between it and button
* CPU utilization, units no longer displaying...can't tell if styling there is right. screenshot attached.

Fixed the label indentation issues and the cancel link styles.  [~dkavanagh] is looking into the missing unit issue.  I was unable to pinpoint the cause of the missing validation error when the alarm name field is blank or when a duplicate alarm name is entered.  [~ashamblin] mentioned he would look into the validation issues.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1893

Getting there!

* Labels still indented way too far. Noted on other ticket as well, fix however you want (one branch, both branches, whatever).
Well, if this is fixed by changing column assignment, it will be fixed in both places. Should we hold this one up till that's fixed?
I suggest we address the layout changes in GUI-2504, as there's already a discussion there, to avoid holding this up (since it blocks GUI-2505 and other tickets atm).
UX review passed, ready for code review!
